pageContext.claim: “Over the decades many presidents and many lawmakers have come and gone and no real progress has been made on immigration. We are now living with the consequences -- and they are tragic -- brought about by decades of political stalemate, partisan gridlock, and national neglect.”
pageContext.analysis: Both George W. Bush and Barack Obama tried hard to achieve a solution that improved border security and provided a possible path to citizenship for 11 million undocumented immigrants, in both cases attracting significant bipartisan support. But the efforts failed because of firm opposition from many right-leaning lawmakers. Obama's bill passed the Senate by a 68-32 vote in 2013 but the Republican-controlled House refused to bring it up for a vote.
